title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 809/91 of 27 March 1991 on a protective measure applicable to imports of provisionality preserved cultivated mushrooms
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 809/91  of 27 March 1991  on a protective measure applicable to imports of provisionality preserved cultivated mushrooms
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. For the period 1 April to 31 July 1991, import licences shall be issued for 14 200 tonnes of cultivated mushrooms provisionally preserved but unsuitable for consumption in that state and covered by CN code ex 0711 90 50.
2. Import licences shall be applied for and issued in accordance with Regulation (EEC) No 2405/89, without prejudice to the specific provisions of this Regulation.

1. The quantity fixed in Article 1 (1) shall be allocated as follows:
(a) 12 200 tonnes to importers who have submitted applications for import licences for the products in question in the course of 1989 and 1990;
(b) 2 000 tonnes to importers who do not fulfil the condition set out in (a).
However, where the quantities specified in (a) or (b) is not applied for, or is only partially applied for, the quantity available shall be allocated to the other group of importers who have submitted applications.
2. (a) No application for a licence submitted by an importer as referred to in paragraph 1 (a) may relate to a quantity in excess of 20 % of the quantity supplied to that importer in 1989 and 1990.
(b) No application for a licence submitted by an importer as referred to in paragraph 1 (b) may relate to a quantity in excess of 15 % of the quantity shown therein.

Applications for import licences shall be submitted to the competent authorities of the Member States on 2 and 3 April 1991. Those authorities shall forward the applications to the Commission by 4 p.m. on 4 April 1991 at the latest,  distinguishing between the quantities applied for under points (a) and (b) of Article 2 (1).

By 5 April 1991 at the latest, the Commission shall fix and communicate by telex to the Member States the quantities for which licences are to be issued for each of the two categories of applications mentioned in Article 2 (1).
The licences for which applications are forwarded pursuant to Article 3 shall be issued on 8 April 1991.
This Regulation shall enter into force on 1 April 1991. This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
